tasks.description: Filter the data point representing October 2020 on the x-axis
tasks.label: October

steps.aoiDescription: First, locate the entire area containing the x-axis labels for all months.
Precisely identify the x-axis label for 'October' within the axis labels area.

tasks.description: Retrieve the oil price value for October 2020 from the y-axis.
tasks.label: October

steps.aoiDescription: Trace a vertical line upward from the October label until you reach the corresponding oil price data point.
Locate the rectangular area representing the oil price data point for October 2020.
Visually scan horizontally from the October data point toward the y-axis to read the corresponding oil price value.
Focus your attention on the closest y-axis tick where your horizontal eye scan meets the axis. This helps confirm the oil price value for October.

tasks.description: Filter the data point representing December 2020 on the x-axis
tasks.label: December

steps.aoiDescription: First, locate the entire area containing the x-axis labels for all months.
Precisely identify the x-axis label for 'December' within the axis labels area.

tasks.description: Retrieve the oil price value for December 2020 from the y-axis.
tasks.label: December

steps.aoiDescription: Trace a vertical line upward from the December label until you reach the corresponding oil price data point.
Locate the rectangular area representing the oil price data point for December 2020.
Visually scan horizontally from the December data point toward the y-axis to read the corresponding oil price value.
Focus your attention on the closest y-axis tick where your horizontal eye scan meets the axis. This helps confirm the oil price value for December.

tasks.description: Compute the difference in oil price by subtracting the oil price in October from the oil price in December.

steps.aoiDescription: Locate the tick on the y-axis that corresponds to the October oil price.
Locate the tick on the y-axis that corresponds to the December oil price.
Draw a vertical line on the y-axis to visually represent the difference in oil prices between December and October.

steps.stepName: Highlight X-axis Labels for Both Months
steps.aoiDescription: Locate and compare the x-axis labels for October and December to ensure you're viewing the correct data points for the price difference.
Also confirm the x-axis label for December to pair it with October for the price difference calculation.
